topic.title: Flexible Ethernet Mapping Processor (FEMP) Functional Model

body.p: The FEMP supports the following atomic functions:

ul.li: FlexE to ETCflex adaptation sink functions (FlexE/ETCFlex_A_Sk)
ODUkP to ETCflex adaptation source functions (ODUflex/ETCflex_A_So)
ODUkP to ETH adaptation source functions (ODUkP/ETH_A_So)
ODUflexP to FlexESG adaptation source functions (ODUflex/FlexESG_A_So)
ODUkP to CBRx BMP adaptation source functions (ODUkP/CBRx-b_A_So)
ODU4P to CBRETC6 GMP adaptation source functions (ODU4P/CBRETC6-g_A_So)
ETCflex to ETH adaptation source functions (ETCflex//ETHA_A_So)
ETCflex trail termination source functions (ETCflex_TT_So)
ODUkP to ETCflex BMP adaptation source functions (ODUkP/ETCflex-b_A_So)
ODUkP to ETCflex GMP adaptation source functions (ODU4P/ETCflex-g_A_So)
ETYn to CBRx_A adaptation sink functions (ETYn/CBRx_A_Sk)

body.p: The FlexE/ETCFlex_A_Sk functions are detailed in ITU-T G.8021/Y.1341 and OIF-FLEXE-01.0 . Most FlexE/ETCFlex_A_Sk functions are implemented within the FLEXE_MUX and FLEXE_DEMUX. The functions done in FEMP are listed below:

ul.li: Replacement signal generation
Rate adaptation idle insert/delete.

body.p: The ODUkP/ETCflex_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.798 section 14.3.17. Most of these functions are implemented in the MAPOTN subsystem, the functions implemented in the FEMP are listed below:

ul.li: Rate adaptation idle delete (IMP).
Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream.

body.p: The ODUkP/ETH_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.798 section 14.3.11 and ITU-T G.8021/Y.1341 section 11.5.1. Most of these functions are implemented in the MAPOTN subsystem, the functions implemented in the FEMP are listed below:

ul.li: Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream.
Computes GFP aCMF-RDI and aCMF-FDI for insertion downstream
Computes GFP aCSF-LOS-Sig and aCSF-LOS-Sync for insertion downstream

body.p: If required, the Ethernet FCS is not re-generated, it is preserved from the RX MAC.

The ODUflexP/FlexESG_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.798 section 14.3.18.1. Most of these functions are implemented in the FLEXE_DEMUX except the scrambling done in the MAPOTN subsystem and the following functions done in the FEMP:

ul.li: Replacement signal generation
Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream

body.p: The ODUkP/CBRx-b_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.798 sections 14.3.1.2 and 14.3.1.3. Most of these functions are implemented in the MAPOTN subsystem except the following functions done in the FEMP:

ul.li: Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream
Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream

body.p: The ETCflexP/ETH_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.8010/Y.1306 section 6.5.2.1.1.. The ENET subsystem only supports ETCflexP/ETH_A_So connected to ETCflex_TT_So and ODUflexP_So/ETCflex_A_So (IMP). Some ETCflexP/ETH_A_So functions are implemented in the FEPP_I and MAC_RX, others are implemented in the MAPOTN subsystem. Within the FEMP, the ETCflexP/ETH_A_So simply connects the input to its output.
The ETCn_TT_So functions is covered in ITU-T G.8010/Y.1306 section 6.5.2.1.2. There is no functions associated with ETCn_TT_So except to connect the input to its output.

The ODUkP/ETCflex-b_A_So functions are detailed in ITU-T G.798 sections 14.3.1.2 and 14.3.1.3. Most of these functions are implemented in the MAPOTN subsystem except the following functions done in the FEMP:

ul.li: Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream
Idle conversion from clause 82 to clause 49 for 10G BMP mapping (in addition to ITU-G.798 sections 14.3.1.2/14.3.1.3)
Computes client signal fail for insertion downstream
Insertion of alignment markers (in addition to ITU-G.798 section 14.3.8)

body.p: The ETYn/CBRx_A_Sk functions are not detailed in any standards, The ETYn/CBRx_A_Sk simply connects its input to its output.
